caption: A very nice and veried Waterpark. Fits every type of weather, and has options for everything age. Tickets were quite expensive, but it was one of the only options in the area. Well maintained and with short waiting time (people are devided between the slides).

I don't understand the bad reviews, this waterpark is amazing and it's by far my favorite in Switzerland!!! The slides are some of the best in Europe in my opinion, and it's definitely my favorite collection on this continent even after being to dozens of other waterparks. The park is also very well maintained and clean, this was definitely an issue in the past that I noticed since I've gone here very often, but it has been beautifully fixed. (I've visited multiple times between 2024 and 2017) Pricing is definitely high if you don't use any discounts, but after it can get pretty reasonable.

After reading some negative reviews we didn‚Äôt know what to expect- but we had the best afternoon! Such a nice mix of sides and something there for everyone. My kids are 16 and 10 and loved all that was on offer. The car parks were full(not a problem for us as we came by public transport) but the queues were minimal for the slides and it didn‚Äôt feel overcrowded. We bought the 4 hour ticket which was ample. Yes the tickets are pricey but I‚Äôd say great value for money when there is so much on offer. We bought the tickets with SBB and basically got our transport free. Loved the outdoor pools and enjoyed the amazing views across the lake. The pools were well maintained and clean and I really enjoyed the salt water pool. All in all a fantastic day had by all.
I dont understand these ratings. Me and my friends had so much fun here as grown ups. The price is also reasonable in my opinion. Kids had fun and the outside sole area was amazing.

Had a great time  Got in after 6 PM and only paid 33.- CHF and a extra 6.- Francs for the wellness area.  3 or 4 saunas and there are special saunas with ‚ÄûAufguss‚Äú.  Small fitness Center is included in the wellness area.  3 or 4 different bath outside that are 31 to 33 Celsius.  And about 6 watersides and 2 of em are actually tricky even if your  in good shape.  Recommend Alpamare if your near it or on rainy day  Cheers üòÉüôèüèºüçÄ Adam

Extremely unprofessionally made water park. Only one slide was worth it.  The slide Cobra is simply dangerous, i am an adult and i was flipped on my stomach in this slide even though i did everything according to rules.  Also, no controllers on slides, so some people never waited the green light and went straight on another people.  Outside the floor is extremely slippery and hot, slipped 3 times and i am careful.  Definitely overpriced for this experience

I went there yesterday and it was one of the best waterparks I have ever been! The slides were awesome, and also the pools! But it was a bit tiring to climb up all the stairs with the floaties. I had a great day, and I will definitely come again!

I have been coming to this place since 2002, keep that in mind while I write this review. This place offers a lot of selection from the huge indoor Wave pool, numerous selections of slides and exterior circle jet pool with a leisure section as well. I also noticed they do have a young kids area as well. Now going back to my earlier statement I have been coming here since 2002 as a teenager now that I am older with kids! My kids now come here as well when we travel to Switzerland. Almost forgot they do have a place to eat inside as well. Look the place is not a brand new building! It shows its age, but is a great place for memories give it a shot!

Nice evening visit, though the 46chf for a 4h ticket is crazy. ‚Ä¢Arriving: Bought a 4h ticket in the afternoon (sunday). The parking lot is a bit hidden, due to a construction work. It is expensive but at least the car park was free. Was not too busy and the slides had only a max. of 5min waits. Inside it looks pretty clean and you see that the facilities and changing rooms have all been renovated. ‚Ä¢Slides: The water slides are of course Alpamare's strongest. They got a nice variety of slides. Notable favorites are Cresta Canyon (very fast tire slide), Jungle Run (fun and fast double racing body slide), Tornado (funnel slide) and Blizzard (fast body slide). Mini canyon was also pretty fun. Cobra is fun as well but you get thrown around a lot. The cone slide is ok but you often stall in the cones and the lazy river slide seems like a design fail since you always get stuck. ‚Ä¢Pools: The wave pool is pretty fun, has large waves. I enjoyed the 36¬∞C salt water pool with its whirlpools its perfect to relax. The pool with the water current is also fun but tends to be very crowded.  Verdict: ++slides +pools +cleanliness -price

The toddler area is in the last floor downstairs and it is challenging to reach there because the stairs are wet. Dangerous!!! In fact, it is was empty.... Unfortunately my babies had to play in the slide from the garden, the one with the penguin. Very bad access for babies facilities...

to be honest, I don't get why a low score. Yes, it is super expensive even by Swiss standards. And it's a bit crowded and noisy, but it's a park for family and kids.  It is a decent place with 12 slides (probably one of the biggest indoor waterpark in Europe, definitely the one we have been to). The toddler area is also big and with its own slides. The sauna place is nice and quiet too. But some limitations to keep in mind.
Wonderful waterpark with many slides and activities for all ages and levels of daredevils. Both indoor and outdoor water fun and a decent restaurant.

I was there a couple of times and most of the times it was a pleasant experience. My last visit during a weekday, however, was less than perfect: The entire pool and slides area was very cold (apparently there was no heating). This is especially unpleasant if you have to wait in line at the water slides. In addition, at least 2 slides were closed but I wasn't informed about this when I paid for the tickets. In addition, there should have been a small price reduction if not all slides are open. The whole facility seems older and not well maintained. You can for example observe some pool mosaic tiles that have fallen out if you are at the outside pool areas. Inside, at the walls next to some slides you can see mold. It seems the owner has no interest in investing money in the proper maintenance of the facility. The restaurant is very small and very busy at lunch time with long waitign queues and usually no place to sit during rush hour. The food itself is rather of poor quality and expensive.  The slides themselves are fun, but the Cobra slide is probably a bit too much, at least for me: I get hurt every time I use it despite following all rules. My son hit his right ellbow in the jungle run slides and had a small wound with blood coming out (nothing serious but an indication that this slide can be dangerous as well!).

Nice indoor waterpark. Lot of fun especially in winter or rain when there are limited things to do. The restaurant inside is also decent with some vegetation options. We had lot of fun here on a snowy day. Whirlpool and wave pool are a lot of fun.
Was alright, it‚Äôs very busy and kinda unhygienic. The food is quite okay and there‚Äôs lovely sections.
Good for family and kids, value for the money not that great but good location with parking space.

We came here on a Friday and it was perfect.  Not many people ,  no queues for the slides .  Weather was great in February so we all enjoyed the outside pools.   In our opinion it was very clean and well organised.  Staff were very helpful and we all enjoyed our visit

Had a very good experience. Best Toddler‚Äòs area so far! However, it would be great if they could open up the sauna/quiet area for small kids especially the ones that are sleeping. Aquabasilea allows even babies in their sauna and quiet areas. Surely, Alpamare could also make this happen. üòâ

Heavily overpriced for the quality you get, the facilities need a renovation, everything is uncared for. You‚Äôd assume tehy cash in enough money to be able to peoperly maintain the building and the slides..

In 2008 this was a clean, well run facility with healthy food and well trained staff. It was a refreshing change to visit a water park where health and safety was parked at the door and dangerously fun slides could be enjoyed. Today, none of the above applies except the omission of health and safety, however the poor maintenance introduces an unnecessary risk not designed into the original rides. The whole facility requires a full refurbishment or rebuild.

Overall the water park is nice. A good variety of swimming pools and slides. I would have given 5 starts, however the meal I had (fish and chips) was quite bad. Very very oily... Having different kind of potato fries or different fish batter could help with that problem.. I did not finish the meal

We enjoyed our visit here. We were lucky to go here on a weekday, so we almost had the place to ourselves. Many slides, and they were all great fun. Everything very clean. Our kids with ages 8 and 5 also enjoyed it very much.

What an experience! The staff are lovely, and the slides are amazing. There is a good range of slides available for all levels of thrill seekers. Beware, the cobra and the jungle are serious slides for experienced sliders only. You should put your hands around your head for the cobra. The wellness spa is also lit! The sauna rituals are very relaxing and you can tell the staff are experts. I can only recommend. You also get a 30% discount for Kulturlegi!

This is a real place of fun and joy. Waterslides are great and pools are awesome. But I find the food totally overpriced. You pay extremely much and got to prepare it on your on from the paper plate. For service like this food should cost less. For instance, the üçü pomme frittes cost less at the Christmas market but you got it already fried. That is insane

We took our toddler who loves slides because he usually cannot use the slides in europe due to age and/or size restrictions. He also absolutely loves water :)  The slides you can have with small kids are nicely described (you see two people sliding or it says the parent has to lie but the kid can sit). However the toddler area totally needs investment. Currently in aquaparks the toddler areas have soft and grippy floor (a bit similar as on playground) on the whole space, EVERYWHERE! Here however there are only rubber mats on the pathways and most of the floor is a slippery toddler danger. There are cool toddler devices but if your baby wants to have fun they will end up slipping and hurting themselves. The same with the toddler pool, the sides of it are plastic and a huge danger for the babies. Moreover some sprinkle devices inside the todller pool have probably seen their better times and will never be fixed (i.e. the turtle). This cannot be because toddlers do not follow the path but want to run around, and this is supposed to be a place for them.  I also tried the slides without the toddler, and I must say, they are tiptop, the most difficult cobra and the jungle run gave me enough grown up thrill to be really happy :)

Relatively ok - there are almost no lifeguards‚Ä¶ so it‚Äôs normal to see kids in the 1 person slides 2-3 at a time, children (and adults) diving into the outdoor pool (especially the cold pool), and children in the hot (adults only) pool. Maintenance is clearly done on the cheap (eg cracked tiles are cemented over rather than tiles replaced), and tiles of the wrong color (especially in the hot pool) put making it look run down. The food is really the worst part - very low quality and very expensive. That said, the slides are fun, and some feel like slides from my childhood in an era before health-and-safety, making them even more fun

Absolutely loved Alpamare. Yes, it‚Äôs expensive, but not compared to other Swiss prices. Slides were great fun, more than enough tubes and not too much queue‚Äôs. Everything tidy and clean and the restaurant has healthy choices. One thing though: they should make transparent slide, to be able to enjoy the adjacent Lake Z√ºrich.

We had an overall great experience here. Since we went on a Monday the slides were not overcrowded yet.  Outdoor bathing zone: + Clean and warm water temperature. + The wave pool and other water experiences started on time.  Slides and hallways: + Rich selection of fun slides - Very slippery floors - Some slides were closed for half the day without notice. Good, we had the day pass.  Restaurant: + Can pay normally or by putting the charge on the wristband used for entry. + Nice personnel +/- Decent food options. The lower restaurant closed at 13:00.  Shower and bathrooms: + Quite clean + Multiple showers with warm water
Super fun, clean, efficient, and easy to get to. Lots of slides and pools to choose from and we had no waiting for slides.
Very entertaining for a small price. Slides are amazing, wave pool and current pull work pretty often. Pools are warm and the sauna is very nice and clean. Im definitely coming back soon.

Had a great time with my 9 year old daughter. She was able of go on all the slides, no problem. We loved Thriller, Cresta, and Tornado the most. The hot pool with jets, the river, and the wave pool were also favorites.

Much better than the last time we visited (cleaner in particular and felt better maintained). Good variety of rides and pools for all ages of kids. A lot of stairs to get around. A bit on the pricey side especially for younger kids.

I visited a water park today with my two friends, and overall, we had a great time enjoying the slides. However, I feel compelled to mention that some of the toboggans labeled as "red" for difficulty seemed extremely dangerous. During our ride, we unexpectedly gained excessive speed and were thrown out of the tube, hitting our heads quite hard. It was alarming to experience a momentary white flash upon impact. Personally, I also injured my arm, and even hours later, it still hurts. I believe such situations can be very hazardous and may lead to severe injuries, possibly even lifelong consequences. It is my hope that the Alpamare team addresses and resolves this issue promptly to ensure the safety of all visitors.  In addition to the concerns about the dangerous toboggans, I must also mention that the food at the water park was disappointing. The quality was subpar, and the prices were excessively high. For instance, a small cheeseburger costing 15 CHF was simply unreasonable and felt like an act of greed on their part. It would be beneficial for the management to reevaluate their pricing and improve the food quality to offer a more enjoyable experience for visitors.
Absolutely loved it! The slides are a lot of fun. Everything felt safe and well designed. Highly recommend!

Overall was a fun visit. The rides are cool and definitely entertaining. The facility is somehow outdated, a renovation would be great, especially the shower and dressing area. Hairdryer also super outdated ü•¥

We tried alpamare  on Sunday, 23rd of July. It was not very crowded and you could try slides multiple times. The atmosphere is nice and the slide are fairly versatile. Furthermore the parking was free of charge. I do recommend this aqua-park for everyone and also family with kids.

The entrance fees are completely overpriced! It's dirty and unsanitary. In the small children's area there was vomit in several places which was not cleaned, despite notification. Everything is quite run down, rust on the building and everywhere the small mosaic stones on the edges of the pool are loosening, which poses a risk of injury and much more! We were there with our 20-month-old daughter and are very disappointed with the conditions and hygiene conditions. 34

Loads of great slides for kids of all ages. The outdoor area was great but the rapids can be a bit rough. As is the wave pool.  I was disappointed with the lack of lifeguard supervision. I went on a slide with my 5 year old. A group of 3 adult men came down the slide together after us and nearly crashed into us. Changing rooms were hectic. Car park much too small.
